abstract: Bill Daley, the White House chief of staff, sat down for an interview with John Harwood of The Times. What follows is a condensed, edited transcript of their conversation.
snippet: Bill Daley, the White House chief of staff, sat down for an interview with John Harwood of The Times. What follows is a condensed, edited transcript of their conversation.
lead_paragraph: William M. Daley, the former commerce secretary and JPMorgan executive, became White House chief of staff earlier this year with the hope of repairing relations with business and striking deals with Republicans. He's met with considerable frustration, though agreement with Congressional Republicans on new trade deals this week provided a rare note of economic cooperation. He sat down for an interview with John Harwood of The Times and CNBC. What follows is a condensed, edited transcript of their conversation.
